isis.stitle: Recall 97502 - 1652 SC, 3400, 3800, 4600, 4700, and 3000 RE Buses with 9x3 Powered Applied Parking Brake

recall.subject: 1652 SC, 3400, 3800, 4600, 4700, and 3000 RE Buses with 9x3 Powered Applied Parking Brake

defect.para: The power applied parking brake can fail to apply or can release without warning. The power applied parking brake lever can move forward, because the cam lever pivot hole located on the transmission mounting boss is drilled too deep. This allows the cam lever to become disengaged from the parking brake shoes. Should the cam lever become disengaged from the parking brake shoes, the operator would have no warning that the parking brake was not applied. This defect could result in a vehicular accident without warning which could result in personal injury or property damage, or both.

Owners will be notified of this campaign on their vehicles by Navistar. A listing of owner names and addresses has been furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: The hole in the transmission boss (brake lever retainer hole) must have washers installed in it per Figure 1.

step1.para: Place chocks at rear tires to prevent the vehicle from moving. Place the front axle of the vehicle on jack stands.
Release the power applied parking brake.
Disconnect the driveline from the transmission output flange.
Remove the cotter key and clevis pin from the park brake cam lever (refer to Figure 2).
Remove the transmission output flange and parking brake drum.
Remove the 4 retaining bolts from the backing plate.
Remove the backing plate and cam lever from the transmission.
Next, just the right number of washers must be installed. To do this, follow the procedure below.

Add three (3) washers (part number 28588R1) in the brake lever retainer hole in the transmission boss. Make sure the washers are as near the bottom of the hole as possible. There is a very small machined ledge in the hole that the washers must pass to be properly seated (refer to Figure 3).
Re-install park brake cam lever and backing plate to the transmission, making sure the cam lever is in the proper position, engaged in the brake shoes.
Tighten the 4 retaining bolts of the backing plate, being careful not to over-tighten and bend the backing plate should 3 washers be too many.

To verify the proper addition of washers, check the fore and aft movement (end play) of the lever. If there is fore and aft movement, remove the backing plate and cam lever and install another washer. If there is no movement, remove the 4 retaining bolts and remove brake cam lever and backing plate. Remove one washer. Re-install brake cam lever and backing plate to the transmission and again tighten the 4 retaining bolts. Verify the fore and aft movement of the lever. If there is fore and aft movement, then skip to Step 14.

If there is no fore and aft movement, remove 1 more washer and re-check. It is important that initially washers be added to remove all fore and aft movement of the lever, then remove one at a time until there is a detectable brake lever end play. Procedure will normally require 2 or 3 washers to shim the hole to the correct depth.
After the verification procedure is complete and you have confirmed the lever does not bind and has fore and aft movement, torque the 4 backing plate retaining bolts.
Re-install parking brake drum, transmission output flange, and driveline.
Install the clevis pin into the clevis and cam lever arm.
Install the cotter key into the clevis pin.
Check and verify proper park brake operation and adjustment (refer to CTS-5135TA).
Apply the park brake. Remove jack stands from the front axle and remove chocks from the rear tires.

entry.para: * Please check your stock prior to ordering washers to insure that you don't already have ample inventory. This washer comes in multiples of 100.

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward. The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair the vehicle as soon as possible.
